travelers.notes: Business partners (travel agents) and BFFs. Both in 50s, experienced travelers, foodies, good physical health. First time to Portugal. Scouting trip to learn destination for future client sales.

preferences.vibe: Pack it full — culture, food, scenic villages, beaches, shopping. Dual purpose: personal adventure + business reconnaissance.
preferences.budget: Cost-conscious with selective splurges for right experiences
preferences.mobility: No restrictions. Kim prefers shorter car rides (no long drives).
preferences.transportation: Train-based itinerary. No rental car. Day trips from two bases.
mustHave: Shopping - fashion for Susie, unique/off-beaten-path for Kim
See key tourist spots to understand for future clients
avoid: Rental car if practical to skip
preferences.kimPreferences: Mountains, villages, hiking, unique finds, shorter drives

flights.notes: Round-trip Lisbon recommended. Delta JFK-Porto doesn't start until May 2026, so open-jaw not practical for March dates.

alternatives: MSY → JFK → LIS could save money but 2hr drive
routing.reasoning: Kim has Delta status, earns miles. JFK has premium lounges. Overnight transatlantic preferred.

outbound.notes: Overnight flight JFK-LIS. DL272 departs JFK ~8:15pm, arrives LIS 8:00am.

return.notes: DL273 departs LIS ~10:00am, arrives JFK ~1:00pm. Connect home same day.

itinerary.summary: Two bases (Lisbon 4 nights, Porto 4 nights) with day trips by train. No rental car.

days.title: Arrive Lisbon
activities: Check into hotel (early check-in if possible)
Early dinner, early bed to recover

days.title: Sintra Day Trip
activities: Train from Rossio (40 min, every 20 min)
Moorish Castle or Quinta da Regaleira

days.title: Cascais Beach Day
activities: Train from Cais do Sodré (35 min scenic coastal route)

days.title: Train to Porto
activities: Alfa Pendular train to Porto (~3 hrs)

days.title: Douro or Beach Day
activities: OPTION A: Scenic Douro Valley tour (non-wine focused) or train to Peso da Régua
OPTION B: Foz do Douro beach day (tram from center)
TBD based on weather and preferences
days.notes: Leave flexible - decide closer to date

locations.name: Lisbon
locations.purpose: Capital city base. Day trips to Sintra and Cascais.

locations.name: Porto
locations.purpose: Northern base. Walkable city, possible Douro day trip.

requirements.lisbon: Central location (Chiado, Baixa, or Alfama). Walking distance to Rossio and Cais do Sodré stations for day trips. 4 nights.
requirements.porto: Ribeira or Baixa area. Walking distance to São Bento station. 4 nights.

rentalCar.notes: Skipping rental car. Train-based itinerary is more practical and cost-effective.

lisbonToCascais.notes: Scenic coastal route - sit on left side going out

lisbonToPorto.stations: Lisboa Oriente → Porto Campanhã (free transfer to São Bento)
lisbonToPorto.notes: Book in advance for best price. Café-bar on board, WiFi, power outlets.

portoToLisbonAirport.route: Porto Campanhã → Lisboa Oriente → Metro to Airport

localTransport.lisbon: Metro, trams (especially 28E), walking. Consider Lisboa Card for unlimited transport + attractions.
localTransport.porto: Metro, trams, walking. Very walkable city center.

packingGuide.weather: March temperatures range from 55-65°F (12-18°C). Chance of rain.

footwear: Comfortable walking shoes essential - cobblestone streets everywhere
Stylish sneakers or supportive flats work perfectly
Avoid flip-flops which mark you as a tourist
clothing: Well-fitted jeans, chinos, capris, or casual dresses
Layers essential - light jacket, cardigan, or versatile scarf
Modest tops for church visits - shoulders should be covered

suggestions: Nice blouse or sweater with dark jeans or tailored pants
Casual dress with cardigan or blazer
Comfortable but stylish low heels, ankle boots, or dressy flats
avoid: Athletic wear, shorts, or overly casual clothing at dinner

generalTips: Stick to neutrals and earthy tones - black, navy, olive, cream blend in well
Portuguese women tend toward classic, understated elegance over flashy
Versatile scarf doubles as style piece and cover-up for churches
Pack pieces that mix and match easily
Bring a compact umbrella for March
packingGuide.proTip: A lightweight, wrinkle-resistant wardrobe will serve you well. Choose fabrics that travel easily and can be dressed up or down!
